Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial Comparing Proximal Gastrectomy with Double-Tract Reconstruction to Total Gastrectomy in Early-Stage Proximal Gastric Cancer

Trial_Design.evidence: Participants were randomised to PG-DTR or TG-RY.

Participants.evidence: This randomised controlled trial enrolled patients with cT1 to cT2 proximal gastric cancer at Fujian Cancer Hospital.

Intervention.evidence: This study compares proximal gastrectomy with double-tract reconstruction (PG-DTR) to TG with Roux-en-Y reconstruction (TG-RY).

Objective.evidence: This study compares proximal gastrectomy with double-tract reconstruction (PG-DTR) to TG with Roux-en-Y reconstruction (TG-RY) in early-stage proximal gastric cancer.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was postoperative nutritional status at 3 months, assessed by body weight, hemoglobin, and albumin levels.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was computer-generated, with allocation concealed.

Number_Randomised.evidence: 186 patients were randomised: 93 to PG-DTR and 93 to TG-RY.

Result_Outcome.evidence: PG-DTR showed improved nutritional status at 3 months (mean difference in hemoglobin = 1.2 g/dL, 95% CI 0.8 to 1.6; p < 0.01).

Harms.evidence: Adverse events were similar between groups.
